text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Mubarak and Italian President Scalfaro will discuss developments in the peace process, strengthening Egypt's ties with Italy and European-Arab coordination. The Italian president began his visit to Egypt with a trip to the Battle of Alamein memorial.

- Mubarak sends a letter to the Palestinian Human Rights Committee in the United Nations, warns that current deadlock in peace process and Jewish settlements will throw the region into a cycle of violence.
- Prime Minister Kamal Ganzouri says Egypt will set up a free zone in the Gulf of Suez and that the project will provide 140,000 job opportunities.
- Three Egyptian labourers killed and 13 wounded after a wall collapses on top of them in Mecca, Saudi Arabia.

- International evaluation of Egypt's economy. Global institutions place Egypt's economy in the same category as the "Asian Tigers". Ganzouri will meet envoys of these institutions that will rate the economy and provide $200 million in investment annually.
- Ministerial committee to take several investment projects discussed in the Middle East and North Africa Economic Conference to Saudi Arabia.
- Mubarak in a letter to the Palestinian Committee in the United Nations: Israel is pushing the region towards a cycle of violence. We are committed to peace.
- Italian President says Egypt has special status.
- Six Egyptians killed and wounded after a wall collapses in Mecca.
- Israeli official says Egypt has decided to half its oil exports to Israel, adds decision is commercially -- not politically -- motivated.
